author: Kirti Gaur
text: Each time my hand reaches out for a Haruki Murakami book, I keep it back. It's because I know I am gonna cry, I know it's gonna resonate. And I can't risk it.

author: Kirti Gaur
text:
The last one year has been a storm, but I have come out of it. It has changed me, but that's the whole purpose of the storm right?

 I am sure you are gonna be proud of me.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: It's been a year to a lot of things, but it's ur loss I feel the Baba. I'll tell you all about it when I see you again

author: Kirti Gaur
text: U might drown yourself in work or anything else, but your heart knows. And your soul never lies.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Some people will remain teenagers forever lol.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Waiting for my bff to come around soon. Asking readers isn't helping though(they say u got better friends). Idk. And I thought I forgot ppl quickly. But it's been a month 😪

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Happy May ❤️

author: Kirti Gaur
text:
Tell me u r pmsing without exactly mentioning it. 
When you start crying over what happened ten years ago, or if u didn't get ur favourite chocolate or ice cream flavour. And u cry. Fucked up world. Periods are great but they suck as well. Twkk.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Trust your intuition. Trust your intuition. Trust your intuition. ♾️

author: Kirti Gaur
text: They told me to cut the cord, I didn't listen. Now see what's happened.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: The fact that they don't even know that they are traumatised is so sad. Growing up in a dysfunctional household sucks,  and the males might not even acknowledge it because of their inflated ego.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Such men usually seek females who are dominant, cunning and toxic. And since they were not given enough love or emotional support as a child by their mother, they end up being either extremely attached to their mother when they grow up or not being attached at all. No balance.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Imagine some guy being so traumatised in their childhood by female figures that they actually self sabotage their current dealings with females in their life.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: brave*

author: Kirti Gaur
text:
It's been one year to the Delta wave, that claimed a lot of people from us, young and old. 
It's tough remembering it, but it's even tougher living through it.  To the bravest Indians who bore the brunt, u are one tough people. May nobody face such a thing ever!

author: Kirti Gaur
text: I'll keep posting this till people read it.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: "AlRawabi school for girls" on Netflix - it shows every damn thing that happens in a girls' school. To the core. The bullying. Very bad. And the "are u a lesbian jibe"?-Yes. Made fun of because of some random thing, yes. The girls' literally have no empathy.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Hmm. If movies on holocaust, anti semitism, slavery (that show the brutality and  hate unfiltered, don't spread hate but rather tell the public what some communities went through, then KF is no different. It is a brutal truth. Accept it. https://t.co/Ruf2KYKaYq

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Sab barbad ho gaya tab realise hua jo pehle hi ho jaana chahiye tha..there would've been no war had u been neutral and not threatened Russian sovereignty by wanting to join NATO https://t.co/2gO0ol4Q8C

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Exactly the point! There's not even admitting that there was a wrong done, let alone reconciliation! Reconciliation can only happen if there's acknowledgement of the ethnic cleansing, not downplaying it as a propaganda/lie. https://t.co/PbdgPj3e2J

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Reconciliation is possible only if you are willing to recognise the genocide. Officially. If the guilty are punished and tried it n a court of law. Refusing to recognise it as an exodus reflects ur poor ideological compass that can never accept true incidents.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: People compare the ethnic cleansing to every historic cleansing, and say that the pandits should reconcile. What they fail to notice is that the genocide is still NOT recognised officially, like the Sikh riots/Gujarat riots are.

text: All this beauty around you and yet you chose me

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Dear god, please forgive me for settling for the bare minimum and not seeing my value. For tolerating crap. I promise it won't happen again.

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Like everywhere I go, I meet Libras. Like how???My cousins are Libra, my dad, my grandfather, eewwwew. Like no i don't hate em but even friends, new people I meet, Libras?!! Urgh. Tired 🥱 my bff is a Libra wow

author: Kirti Gaur
text: Why is it so tough for people to be honest? I mean I know I can be scary and will rip you apart if you lie(the least I'll do is cut u off my life), but still...🙆🏻‍♀️if you'd been honest in the first place, it wouldn't come to this. Like bitter truths don't piss me off, lies do.
